* [1447]
* [1448]**Preparation and Solid State Characterization of 4,4'-Bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazolyl)] Clinton D Bryan,\({}^{*}\) A Wallace Cordes,\({}^{*}\) Robert C Haddon,\({}^{\text{\text{\tiny{\textregistered}}}}\) Robin G Hicks,\({}^{\text{\text{\tiny{\textregistered}}}}\) Richard T Oakley,\({}^{\text{\text{\tiny{\textregistered}}}}\) Thomas T M Palstra\({}^{\text{\text{\tiny{\textregistered}}}}\) and Alexander J Perel\({}^{\text{\text{\tiny{\textregistered}}}}\)**
* [148]**_Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry, University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, Arkansas 72701, USA_
* [148]**_AT8T Bell Laboratories, 600 Mountain Ave., Murray Hill, New Jersey, 07974, USA_
* [149]**_Guelph-Waterloo Centre for Graduate Work in Chemistry, Guelph Campus, Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry, University of Guelph, Guelph, Ontario N1G 2071, Canada_

The reaction of oxamidrazone with sulfur dichloride affords 4,4'-bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazolium) dichloride, which can be reduced with triphenylantimomy to the corresponding bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazolyl) diradical; the solid state structure and transport properties of the dimer [S\({}_{3}\)N\({}_{2}\)CCN\({}_{2}\)S\({}_{12}\) are reported 
The concept of using neutral \(\pi\)-radicals as building blocks in the design of molecular conductors' has catalysed the study of heterocyclic thiagyl radicals, in particular derivatives of the two isomeric dithiadiazolyls **1** and **2**.[2, 3] Recently we have shown that both monofunctional\({}^{14,5}\) and bifunctional\({}^{1}\) 1,2,3,5-radicals can be doped with iodine to form conductive charge transfer salts As part of the development of these new materials a wide variety of monofunctional derivatives of both isomers have been prepared, as well as several polyfunctional derivatives in which two or more heterocyclic rings are linked by a bridging benzene ring.[7] Bifunctional materials with rings linked through carbon[8] and mercury[9] bridges have also been characterized 
As key structural units the back-to-back radicals **3** and **4** have been synthetic targets for some time The 1,3,2,4-isomer **3** has been isolated as a black powder,[10] but its structure remains elusive This may be related to the known tendency of 1,3,2,4-dithiadiazolyls to isomerize to the 1,2,3,5-derivatives both in solution[11] and the solid state.[12] Our initial attempts to apply an oxamid(s/SC) condensation approach to the 1,2,3,5-isomer **4** were unsuccessful, but we have now discovered that oxamidrazone\({}^{1}\) reacts with (excess) SCI\({}_{2}\) in acetonitrile to afford the citation **5** (as its hydrochloride) in 15% yield [eqn (1)] The crude detection can be reduced with triphenylantimony to afford the dimer of diradical **4** as a black solid We have been able to purify **4** by fractional vacuum sublimation at 140 \({}^{\text{\text{\tiny{\textregistered}}}}\)/C\({}^{10}\) - 2 Torr in a gradient tube furnace to give lustrous blue-black needles of the dimer, mp 275-80 \({}^{\text{\text{\tiny{\textregistered}}}}\) (50% yield based on the crude location **5**) - 1 Mass spectrum (70 eV, EI); 208 (84%, M\({}^{+}\)); 162 (97%, [N\(-\) NS]\({}^{+}\)); 144 (11%, [M \(-\) S\({}_{2}\)]\({}^{+}\)); 130 (31%, [M \(-\) NS]\({}^{+}\)); 116 (14%, [M \(-\) N\({}_{2}\)S\({}_{2}\)]\({}^{+}\)); 104 (5%, M\({}^{+}\)); 78 (45%, S\({}_{2}\)N\({}^{+}\)); 64 (100%, S\({}_{2}\)\({}^{+}\)); 46 (80%, S\({}_{2}\)N\({}^{+}\)); The ESR signal of 4 (in CH\({}_{2}\)Cl\({}_{2}\), 73) consists of a quintet, with \(g=2.0110\) and \(a_{m}=0.50\) mT; there is an indication above 273 K of the onset of exchange coupling between the two rings, but this is less extensive than was observed in the 1,4-phenylene-bridged bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazolyl).[70]

The crystal structure of **4** has been determined by X-ray diffraction: 1t consists of stacks of centrosymmetric dimers packed in a herring-bone fashion Fig 1 illustrates the packing in the \(yz\) plane, while Fig 2 shows the stacking of dimers parallel to \(x\)
summary:
Revised Summary 1: The University of Groningen and the University Medical Center Groningen, in collaboration with the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry at the University of Arkansas, AT&T Bell Laboratories, and the Guelph-Waterloo Centre for Graduate Work in Chemistry, published a paper titled "Preparation and Solid State Characterization of 4,4-Bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazoly!)" in the Journal of the Chemical Society, Chemical Communications in 1994. The authors, Bryan, Clinton D.; Haddon, Robert C.; Hicks, Robin G.; Oakley, Richard T.; Palstra, Thomas T.M.; Perel, Alexander J.; Cordes, A.W, discuss the synthesis and properties of 4,4'-bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazolium) dichloride, a diradical formed by the reaction of oxamidrazone with sulfur dichloride. They report the solid state structure and transport properties of the dimer [S3N2CCN2S12]. The study explores the formation of Conductive Charge Transfer Salts using Heterocyclic Thiagyl Radicals and investigates the isomers and back-to-back radicals as key structural units. The crystal structure of the dimer is determined using X-ray diffraction. The paper provides links to additional resources for further information.

Revised Summary 2: The University of Groningen and the University Medical Center Groningen, in collaboration with the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry at the University of Arkansas, AT&T Bell Laboratories, and the Guelph-Waterloo Centre for Graduate Work in Chemistry, published a paper titled "Preparation and Solid State Characterization of 4,4-Bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazoly!)" in the Journal of the Chemical Society, Chemical Communications in 1994. The authors, Bryan, Clinton D.; Haddon, Robert C.; Hicks, Robin G.; Oakley, Richard T.; Palstra, Thomas T.M.; Perel, Alexander J.; Cordes, A.W, discuss the synthesis and properties of 4,4'-bis(1,2,3,5-dithiadiazolium) dichloride, a diradical formed by the reaction of oxamidrazone with sulfur dichloride. They report the solid state structure and transport properties of the dimer [S3N2CCN2S12]. The study explores the formation of Conductive Charge Transfer Salts using Heterocyclic Thiagyl Radicals and investigates the isomers and back-to-back radicals as key structural units. The crystal structure of the dimer is determined using X-ray diffraction. The paper provides links to additional resources for further information. The synthesis of Oxamidrazone with Sulfur Dichloride via the Back-to-Back Radicals condensation approach is explored in this study. The dimer of the resulting diradical is characterized by its crystal structure using X-ray diffraction. The mass spectrum analysis, as well as vacuum sublimation, are employed for further characterization. The experimental details can be found in the provided DOI link. For more information on self-archiving policies, please refer to the additional links provided.

article:
Chunk # 1.
The internal features of the heterocyclic rings are normal; the S-S, S-N and S-C bonds are all similar to those found in other dithiadiazolyl dimers.[14] The C-C distance suggests little double bond character; at 1.488 A the separation is only slightly shorter than that expected (1.516 A)[15] for an sp\({}^{2-}\)sp\({}^{2}\) single bond The mean intradimer S-S distance (3.078 A) and interdimer S\({}^{\cdots}\)-S contact along the stack (3.761 A) are also similar to those seen in related dimers In the monoclinic phase of [HCN\({}_{2}\)S\({}_{2}\)]\({}_{2}\), for example, these distances (average values) are 3.11 and 3.76 A.[14]

Perhaps the most striking feature of the structure is the number and shortness of the lateral interdimer S\(\cdots\)S contacts Many of these interactions, all of which (d\({}_{1}\)-d\({}_{7}\)) are defined in Figs 1 and 2, are well within the standard van der Waals separation for two sulfurs;[16] collectively they generate a very densely packed structure Extended Huckel band calculations confirm a high degree of dispersion in both the valence and conduction bands 
In the solid state the dimer is diamagnetic, with a residual spin density at room temperature of 0.01% on a per molecule basis The measured diamagnetism is \(-\)90 ppm cmu mol\({}^{-1}\) and the 6-value is \(-\)0.5 K The material exhibits a conductivity of 10\({}^{-8}\) S cm\({}^{-1}\) along the needle axis This value will likely be enhanced by iodine doping, as found for other systems.[4, 5, 6]

We thank the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada, the National Science Foundation (EPSCOR program) and the State of Arkansas for financial support One of us (C D B.) acknowledges a DOE/ASTA Traineship 
_Received, 7th March 1994; Com 4/01346H_

## References

(d) A W Cordes, R C Haddon, R G Hicks, R T Oakley, T T M Palstra, L F Schneemeyer and J V Waszczak, _J Am Chem Soc._, 1992, **114**, 1729; (e) A W Cordes, R C Haddon, R G Hicks, R T Oakley, T T M Palstra, L F Schneemeyer and J V Waszczak, _J Am Chem Soc._, 1992, **114**, 5000 * [8] A J Banister, J M Rawson, W Clegg and S L Birkby, _J Chem Soc., Dalton Trans._, 1991, 1099 * [9] A J Banister, I Lavender, S E Lawrence, J M Rawson and W Clegg, _J Chem Soc., Chem Commun._, 1994, 29 * [10] S Parsons, J Passmore, M J Schriver and P S White, _J Chem Soc.,_ 1991, 369; summary: The internal features of the heterocyclic rings are normal, similar to other dithiadiazolyl dimers. The C-C distance suggests little double bond character. The mean intradimer S-S distance and interdimer S-S contact along the stack are also similar to related dimers. The structure has numerous and short lateral interdimer S-S contacts, generating a densely packed structure. The dimer is diamagnetic in the solid state, with a residual spin density at room temperature. The material exhibits a conductivity along the needle axis. Financial support was provided by various organizations.

topics.topic: Structure and Features of Heterocyclic Rings
topics.justification: The summary mentions the internal features of the heterocyclic rings and compares them to other dithiadiazolyl dimers.
The summary discusses the C-C distance and suggests little double bond character.
The summary mentions the mean intradimer S-S distance and interdimer S-S contact along the stack.
The summary states that the structure has numerous and short lateral interdimer S-S contacts, generating a densely packed structure.
The summary mentions that the dimer is diamagnetic in the solid state and has a residual spin density at room temperature.
The summary states that the material exhibits conductivity along the needle axis.
The summary mentions that financial support was provided by various organizations.

hypothetical_questions.question: What are the internal features of the heterocyclic rings in the dithiadiazolyl dimers?
How does the C-C distance in the dithiadiazolyl dimers indicate the presence of little double bond character?
If the lateral interdimer S-S contacts were longer and less numerous, how would it affect the density of the packed structure?
How do the mean intradimer S-S distance and interdimer S-S contact compare to those of other related dimers?
How might the conductivity along the needle axis of the material be utilized in practical applications?
